docs.abstract: Europe was an early backer of solar power technology. But its panel manufacturing has fallen off, and China has emerged as the dominant force.
docs.snippet: Europe was an early backer of solar power technology. But its panel manufacturing has fallen off, and China has emerged as the dominant force.
docs.lead_paragraph: CATANIA, Italy — The enormous glass building on the outskirts of this Sicilian city had been intended for making silicon wafers for flash memory chips. That plan got crushed by the global financial crisis.

headline.main: In Shadow of Mt. Etna, Europe Makes a Last Stand for Solar

byline.original: By Stanley Reed and Keith Bradsher

docs.abstract: Slowdowns in investment and retail sales are cooling one of the world’s most important economic engines. As the trade war with the U.S. intensifies, the downturn could get worse.
docs.snippet: Slowdowns in investment and retail sales are cooling one of the world’s most important economic engines. As the trade war with the U.S. intensifies, the downturn could get worse.
docs.lead_paragraph: Sputtering growth, soaring debt and an escalating trade war with the United States are increasingly weighing on China’s economy.

headline.main: China’s Growth Hits Slowest Pace in a Decade
headline.print_headline: China’s Economy Decelerates  To Slowest Pace in a Decade

docs.abstract: Shares of carmakers have slipped more than 25 percent this year, as higher interest rates, lower sales and rising trade tensions bite.
docs.snippet: Shares of carmakers have slipped more than 25 percent this year, as higher interest rates, lower sales and rising trade tensions bite.
docs.lead_paragraph: Stocks slipped Monday, with the benchmark Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index ending down 0.4 percent, adding to an already steep decline in October. Financial shares led the declines, falling 2 percent. Energy shares also slumped more than 1 percent, as Halliburton warned of slowing demand for its hydraulic fracturing services in the fourth quarter. Halliburton itself dropped 3 percent. Also down Monday was the toymaker Hasbro, which fell more than 3 percent after its earnings showed it was still feeling the pinch from the bankruptcy of Toys “R” Us.

headline.main: Stocks Slip Again, and Automakers Continue a Long Decline

docs.abstract: The fees, imposed by more urban hotels in the last few years, cover amenities like high-speed internet access. Many travelers booking online, though, might not realize they will be charged.
docs.snippet: The fees, imposed by more urban hotels in the last few years, cover amenities like high-speed internet access. Many travelers booking online, though, might not realize they will be charged.
docs.lead_paragraph: Resort fees. The term conjures up a poolside lounge chair, thick towels piled high nearby.

headline.main: Paying a ‘Resort Fee’ When You’re Not at a Resort
headline.print_headline: Taking a Page From Airlines, Luxury Hotels Try Piling On Fees

docs.abstract: In “Reporter,” Mr. Hersh revisits his coverage of Vietnam, Nixon and Bin Laden. “I will happily permit history to be the judge of my recent work,” he said.
docs.snippet: In “Reporter,” Mr. Hersh revisits his coverage of Vietnam, Nixon and Bin Laden. “I will happily permit history to be the judge of my recent work,” he said.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Seymour M. Hersh didn’t even want to write a memoir.

headline.main: I, Sy: Seymour Hersh’s Memoir of a Life Making the Mighty Sweat
headline.print_headline: Hersh’s Memoir Is Caustic  And Revealing. What Else?

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

docs.abstract: Technology has helped spawn a virtual currency market, which is highly volatile. Here’s how Nathaniel Popper, who covers cryptocurrencies, keeps on top of the changes.
docs.snippet: Technology has helped spawn a virtual currency market, which is highly volatile. Here’s how Nathaniel Popper, who covers cryptocurrencies, keeps on top of the changes.
docs.lead_paragraph: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Nathaniel Popper, who covers cryptocurrencies and financial technology for The Times from San Francisco, discussed the tech he’s using.

headline.main: When Cryptocurrencies Fluctuate, He Uses These Tech Tools to Keep Track
headline.print_headline: Tracking Changes In a Volatile Market For Cryptocurrency

docs.abstract: The Trump administration took possession of a journalist’s email and phone records as part of a leak investigation.
docs.snippet: The Trump administration took possession of a journalist’s email and phone records as part of a leak investigation.
docs.lead_paragraph: The revelation that federal prosecutors seized years’ worth of email and phone records from a New York Times reporter drew criticism on Friday from news organizations and press rights groups, which expressed outrage at the first known instance of the Trump administration’s pursuing the private communications of a journalist.

headline.main: Press Groups Criticize the Seizing of a Times Reporter’s Records
headline.print_headline: Seizing of Reporter’s Records Is ‘Fundamental Threat,’ Press Groups Say

docs.abstract: A two-time Pulitzer winner and a leader of the newspaper’s digital initiatives takes over the section at an unsettled time for local news coverage.
docs.snippet: A two-time Pulitzer winner and a leader of the newspaper’s digital initiatives takes over the section at an unsettled time for local news coverage.
docs.lead_paragraph: The New York Times said on Tuesday that Clifford J. Levy, a two-time Pulitzer Prize-winning reporter and a leader of the newsroom’s digital initiatives, will be its next metropolitan editor.

headline.main: New York Times Names Cliff Levy as Its New Metro Editor
headline.print_headline: The Times Appoints Levy  To Be Metropolitan Editor

docs.abstract: The Times said that it was reviewing Ali Watkins’s involvement in the case, including her relationship with James Wolfe, a former Senate Intelligence Committee aide.
docs.snippet: The Times said that it was reviewing Ali Watkins’s involvement in the case, including her relationship with James Wolfe, a former Senate Intelligence Committee aide.
docs.lead_paragraph: The New York Times is reviewing the work history of Ali Watkins, a Washington-based reporter at the newspaper whose email and phone records were seized by prosecutors in a leak investigation case that has prompted an outcry among press advocates.

headline.main: New York Times Examines Work History of Reporter in Leak Case
headline.print_headline: Times Reviews Reporter’s Involvement in Leak Case

docs.abstract: President Trump’s top economic adviser is at Walter Reed Medical Center and is expected to fully recover, the White House said.
docs.snippet: President Trump’s top economic adviser is at Walter Reed Medical Center and is expected to fully recover, the White House said.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Larry Kudlow, President Trump’s top economic adviser, suffered a heart attack on Monday evening and was at Walter Reed Medical Center, Mr. Trump said in a tweet.

headline.main: Larry Kudlow Suffers ‘Very Mild’ Heart Attack
headline.print_headline: Top Adviser to Trump Has A ‘Very Mild’ Heart Attack

byline.original: By Jim Tankersley and Maggie Haberman
